Renewable Energy Capacity Expansion:NGEL continued to grow its renewable energy capacity. A 75 MW capacity of the IRCON Renewable Power Plant (Lot-4), part of a larger 500 MW project by a joint venture involving NGEL, was commissioned and operationalized, bringing the total operational capacity of the project to 225 MW.

Strategic Partnerships and Initiatives:NGEL partnered with Honeywell UOP to explore sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) production.

Financial Performance:While specific financial results for May 1, 2025, were not available, NGEL demonstrated strong financial performance in prior quarters due to expanding operations. In Q1 FY2025-26, the company reported a consolidated net profit of ₹2.20 billion, a 58% increase year-over-year. Revenue rose by 17.6% to ₹6.80 billion, and EBITDA reached ₹6.03 billion with a stable margin of 88.73%.

Joint Venture:On April 8, 2025, NGEL formed a joint venture with MAHAPREIT to develop, operate, and maintain renewable energy parks across India, targeting up to 10 GW capacity.

Borrowing Approval:The Board approved borrowing up to ₹5,000 crore for FY 2025-26 on April 29, 2025, to support expansion.

NTPC Green Energy Limited (NGEL) made significant strides in expanding its renewable energy portfolio and strengthening its financial position as of May 1, 2025 .
